VIEW_VERSION_CONTROL.name: View Development Tools
VIEW_VERSION_CONTROL.description: Allows users to view development-related information on the view issue screen, like commits, reviews and build information.

CLOSE_ISSUE.name: Close Issues
CLOSE_ISSUE.description: Ability to close issues. Often useful where your developers resolve issues, and a QA department closes them.

CREATE_SHARED_OBJECTS.name: Create Shared Objects
CREATE_SHARED_OBJECTS.description: Ability to share dashboards and filters with other users, groups and roles.

VIEW_VOTERS_AND_WATCHERS.name: View Voters and Watchers
VIEW_VOTERS_AND_WATCHERS.description: Ability to view the voters and watchers of an issue.

WORKLOG_DELETE_OWN.name: Delete Own Worklogs
WORKLOG_DELETE_OWN.description: Ability to delete own worklogs made on issues.

WORKLOG_EDIT_OWN.name: Edit Own Worklogs
WORKLOG_EDIT_OWN.description: Ability to edit own worklogs made on issues.

LINK_ISSUE.name: Link Issues
LINK_ISSUE.description: Ability to link issues together and create linked issues. Only useful if issue linking is turned on.

BROWSE.name: Browse Projects
BROWSE.description: Ability to browse projects and the issues within them.

COMMENT_DELETE_ALL.name: Delete All Comments
COMMENT_DELETE_ALL.description: Ability to delete all comments made on issues.

MANAGE_WATCHER_LIST.name: Manage Watchers
MANAGE_WATCHER_LIST.description: Ability to manage the watchers of an issue.

ASSIGN_ISSUE.name: Assign Issues
ASSIGN_ISSUE.description: Ability to assign issues to other people.

ATTACHMENT_DELETE_OWN.name: Delete Own Attachments
ATTACHMENT_DELETE_OWN.description: Users with this permission may delete own attachments.

SET_ISSUE_SECURITY.name: Set Issue Security
SET_ISSUE_SECURITY.description: Ability to set the level of security on an issue so that only people in that security level can see the issue.

MANAGE_GROUP_FILTER_SUBSCRIPTIONS.name: Manage Group Filter Subscriptions
MANAGE_GROUP_FILTER_SUBSCRIPTIONS.description: Ability to manage (create and delete) group filter subscriptions.

MOVE_ISSUE.name: Move Issues
MOVE_ISSUE.description: Ability to move issues between projects or between workflows of the same project (if applicable). Note the user can only move issues to a project he or she has the create permission for.

CREATE_ATTACHMENT.name: Create Attachments
CREATE_ATTACHMENT.description: Users with this permission may create attachments.

SCHEDULE_ISSUE.name: Schedule Issues
SCHEDULE_ISSUE.description: Ability to view or edit an issue's due date.

ADMINISTER.name: JIRA Administrators
ADMINISTER.description: Ability to perform most administration functions (excluding Import & Export, SMTP Configuration, etc.).

ATTACHMENT_DELETE_ALL.name: Delete All Attachments
ATTACHMENT_DELETE_ALL.description: Users with this permission may delete all attachments.

BULK_CHANGE.name: Bulk Change
BULK_CHANGE.description: Ability to modify a collection of issues at once. For example, resolve multiple issues in one step.

WORKLOG_EDIT_ALL.name: Edit All Worklogs
WORKLOG_EDIT_ALL.description: Ability to edit all worklogs made on issues.

WORK_ISSUE.name: Work On Issues
WORK_ISSUE.description: Ability to log work done against an issue. Only useful if Time Tracking is turned on.

PROJECT_ADMIN.name: Administer Projects
PROJECT_ADMIN.description: Ability to administer a project in JIRA.

SYSTEM_ADMIN.name: JIRA System Administrators
SYSTEM_ADMIN.description: Ability to perform all administration functions. There must be at least one group with this permission.

WORKLOG_DELETE_ALL.name: Delete All Worklogs
WORKLOG_DELETE_ALL.description: Ability to delete all worklogs made on issues.

ASSIGNABLE_USER.name: Assignable User
ASSIGNABLE_USER.description: Users with this permission may be assigned to issues.

USER_PICKER.name: Browse Users
USER_PICKER.description: Ability to select a user or group from a popup window as well as the ability to use the 'share' issues feature. Users with this permission will also be able to see names of all users and groups in the system.

COMMENT_EDIT_OWN.name: Edit Own Comments
COMMENT_EDIT_OWN.description: Ability to edit own comments made on issues.

USE.name: JIRA Users
USE.description: Ability to log in to JIRA. They are a 'user'.  Any new users created will automatically join these groups, unless those groups have JIRA System Administrators or JIRA Administrators permissions.

COMMENT_DELETE_OWN.name: Delete Own Comments
COMMENT_DELETE_OWN.description: Ability to delete own comments made on issues.

COMMENT_EDIT_ALL.name: Edit All Comments
COMMENT_EDIT_ALL.description: Ability to edit all comments made on issues.

MODIFY_REPORTER.name: Modify Reporter
MODIFY_REPORTER.description: Ability to modify the reporter when creating or editing an issue.

RESOLVE_ISSUE.name: Resolve Issues
RESOLVE_ISSUE.description: Ability to resolve and reopen issues. This includes the ability to set a fix version.
